title: Kenath
html: KENATH(Keʹnath).A site E of the Jordan captured by Nobah, probably a Manassite, who thereafter called it by his own name. (Nu 32:42) But the designation “Nobah” perhaps did not stick, for later “Kenath” is reported to have been taken by Geshur and Syria. (1Ch 2:23) Kenath is identified with the ruins at Kanaouat (or Canatha), about 90 km (60 mi) SSE of Damascus and 7 km (4.5 mi) NW of modern Soueida. Kanaouat was one of the original ten cities of the Decapolis.
